GP102.name: English II
GP102.content: Language development, Communication through reading, Communication through listening, Communication through writing, Communication through speech

GP106.name: Computing
GP106.content: Introduction to computing, Problem solving with mathematical packages (as a calculator), The fundamentals of algorithms, Introduction to high-level programming languages, Problem solving with programs, Scientific programming with a mathematical package
GP106.Objectives: The aim of the module is to teach basic building blocks of a computer and software design so that the students will be able to formulate and solve complex engineering problems by using computers

references.0: Brian H. Hahn and Daniel T. Valentine, Essential Matlab for Engineers and Scientists, 4e, Elsevier, 2010, ISBN: 978-0-12-374883-6
references.1: R. G. Ragel and D. S. Deegalla, Programming with Matlab, Lecture Notes for GP106, 2014

GP111.name: Elementary Thermodynamics
GP111.content: Fundamentals, The Zeroth Law and the First Law, Thermodynamic substances, Application of the First Law to closed systems, Application of the First Law to open systems, Air standard cycles, The Rankine cycle, The Second Law, Laboratory classes

GP113.name: Fundamentals of Manufacture
GP113.content: Introduction to manufacturing industry, Introduction to manufacturing processes and safety measures, Machining: Casting: Welding, Metal forming and Forging, Manufacturing systems, Automobile technology, Printed circuit board (PCB) fabrication and soldering and related technologies
GP113.Objectives: To provide fundamental knowledge on Manufacturing Engineering enabling students to evaluate, design and manufacture products satisfying organizational and consumer requirements and to select, perform and control manufacturing machines and use materials and equipment in a coordinated manner satisfying economies and standards.

references.0: Anderson, J., and Tatro, E.E., Shop Theory, 6th Edition, Tata McGraw-Hill, New Delhi, 2001.
references.1: Chapman, W.A.J., Workshop Technology, Part II.

GP116.name: Linera Algebra
GP116.content: Vectors, Matrix theory, Determinants, Transformations, Solution of simultaneous equations, Vector space, Characteristic value problems, Quadratic forms
GP116.Objectives: To encourage students to develop a working knowledge of the central ideas of linear algebra: vector spaces, linear transformations, orthogonality, eigenvalues, eigenvectors and canonical forms and the applications of these ideas in science and engineering

references.1: Elementary Linear Algebra and its Applications-James W. Daniel
references.2: Matrices for Scientists and Engineers - W.W. Bell
references.3: Linear Algebra with Applications - H.G. Campbell
references.4: Elementary Linear and Matrix Algebra. The view point of Geometry- John T. Moore
references.5: Matrix Algebra for Engineers - J.M. Gere
references.6: Introduction to Linear Algebra- Gilbert Strang
